H0.text: In 1848, Mexico ratified the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, officially ceding what to the USA. Territory

H1.text: In 1848, Mexico ratified the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, officially ceding what to the USA. Mineral Rights

H2.text: In 1848, Mexico ratified the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, officially ceding what to the USA. Waterways

H3.text: In 1848, Mexico ratified the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, officially ceding what to the USA. Land

A4.text: The resulting treaty required Mexico to cede 55 percent of its territory including the present-day states of California, Nevada, Utah, most of Colorado, New Mexico and Arizona, and a small portion of Wyoming.

A5.text: The Mexican Cession included essentially the entirety of the former Mexican territory of Alta California, but only the western portion of Santa Fe de Nuevo Mexico, and includes all of present-day California, Nevada and Utah, most of Arizona, western portions of New Mexico and Colorado, and the southwestern corner of Wyoming.
